The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in spherical heads, which are followed by flat, pod-like fruits. Acacia singula thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
